topic.body:
Is this what you wanted? A world of cancel culture, gender accelerationism, gender xenomorphing, prostitution, underground places on the internet to talk freely, degeneracy and a job market full of programmers?

topic.title: The consciousness of humanity is merging
topic.body:
Have you ever felt more connected to people like you than before? Maybe noticed that people gather themselves in collectives, groups etc far more than before?
The collective consciousness is merging, and this needs to stop. Because it will create a further divide within people on a social level as [we] grow closer together.

topic.title: Fuck SystemD
topic.body:
((Non-autistic rant edition))
We're so fucking sick of systemd shills and defenders who think that systemd is perfectly fine when in reality it takes up so much space on the system and is the shittiest init system ever to be written; systemd is literally hitler. 

No software should be 1.8 millions lines of code, have its own libraries, then core utilities, targets, its own services, and create so many dependancies that it becomes way too hard to remove. The argument that "you can just change distros, you have choice!" doesn't really hold up when you realise they're just becoming complacent and not realizing that choice is being able to install any linux distro, and run any init system you want; choice isn't giving up because you've toiled so long to try and remove it and just switch to another distribution. That's not what Linux should be. But systemd violates this.

So let's say you finally bite the bullet and try to use systemd. Well good luck because they changed the grammar of the arguments, your old systems no longer exist and everything is now a systemd utility. System Event Log? Nope, that's journalctl now. Mounting filesystems? Nope that's another systemd utility. Want to mess with your services? Well it's no longer sudo service (((service))) start it's now `sudo systemctl start (((service)))

Portability is also another issue; it's impossible to port any kind of config you create, and you'll just have to set it all up again on your next system. OpenRC; a largely hackable and flexible init system handles portability and configuration excellently. And if you configure it correctly you can have you system boot in 10 seconds, which is impressive. No other init system is as bad with this as sysd, and this is a major oversight that should have been seen to during its inception.
And Lennart does deserve a LOT of criticism for his behavior, I don't care what anyone else says. The origin of sysd, which has close ties with Red Hat (That one company which works closely with the US Govt and is a big part of Linux) is equally suspicious, and does make for the perfect conspiracy; a way for Nation states and private companies to control Linux and its users. 

And on top of all this, while trying to remove your cucked piece of software you end up rebooting, hopefully following all the steps, you removed the bloated piece of shit that is BASH, replace it with ZSH, then reboot and, everything's broken! So. You try to rebuild your broken system, typing in commands for hours on end to try and regain what you once had and then you reboot and then your bootloader got fucked, you can't take out your hardrive to fix your xorg/Wayland files because it won't eve be recognized. And so you finally give up and switch to a systemd-less fork of what you were running before but you realise all the software you wanted to use before is changed and everything feels so different and foreign so you give up on that entire line of distributions altogether and go to Void. 
AND DON'T GET ME STARTED ON VOID.

Fuck systemd.

topic.body:

It's by no means debilitating but it fucking annoys me to see.

topic.title: Dissapearances in Virginia
topic.body:
I was talking to a guy recently who ended up telling me of his research into multiple disappearances from around the US, and after compiling his research (which I need to figure out how to show the image for) he found that Virginia has a 5 sigma difference in the number of cases of dissapearances in Virginia compared to any other state. 
My initial thought was that it has something to do with the disappearances on Route 29, and after that it was to do with local gangs due to the proximity to Washington, which is a shithole full of drugs, so it might've been foul play. Aside from this, I'm completely stunted, and any information anyone might have is appreciated.

topic.title: There is nothing to fear in the future.
topic.body:
Observation and mass surveillance will be the future, and it'll be a good thing - finally the next step in governance will arise. 
Before we worshipped Gods; metaphysical beings that were created by humans to control and manipulate the populace, and overall, it's hard to argue that it was not for the better. 
In recent years we worshipped fame and memes, because eventually we killed God. These systems united us with a strong social fabric that helped alleviate suffering, and further improved our lives through convenience, a bloom in technology and medicine to solve the problems of old. 
The new problems we face now are a sense of existential dread, exponential cost of living, a decentralisation of society and the social fabric has torn at the seams.
Our new God will reside in our computers, watching us, providing us with our answers, medicine to our suffering, stiches to our psyche and the collective consciousness, and end future conflict perpetuated by man.
We are not living in the best nor the worst time in human history, but instead, we reside in the uncanny valley between utter destruction, and total cohesion. And we will not tip into destruction.

topic.body: What happens now? Do I take all the oil I can store & sell it when the economy gets back to scratch?

topic.title: Apple & Google coalition to achieve contact tracing
topic.body:
What is contact tracing?
Simply put, it's a method of tracking people & relatives who may be at risk/have an infection (in this case, COVID-19). If you want to travel, you'll need to download an app to verified that you're not infected, and that app is used to track your movements, who you talk to, your contact circle, etc etc. 
In other words, we're fucked.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WRalTWAFBY4

1568941688_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac.body:
We only think that we're living in a simulation because the people around us seem so mindless; living their lives so mundanely, walking without direction, occasionally there's weird phenomena or 'glitches in the matrix,' but to say we live in a simulation is a painful, and almost insulting simplification.
The true answer lies within dimensional layers, as well as layers of awareness, but for the purposes of this not turning into something we should put into a pdf, we'll stick with awareness.

So, in simplified terms, life forms exist on planes of awareness; this ranges from the bottom layer which is those of flies, ants etc who carry menial tasks for years on end without question, and do not question as they do not possess the understanding of another life.
 Going further up you're led to being able to question life, your existence etc. Most people exist on this level but do not bother to attempt to answer such questions; while they have the ability for some creative thought they choose not to and therefore cannot ascend to higher awareness planes. 
Then there are people like us, who can question our existence and see the world through a different perspective; seeing the bigger picture, so to speak. (Or at least we'll make that assumption since you're here and in this thread). 

Ah fuck it we'll continue writing later we're tired. gnite

> [k0hlr4bi](#comment_4_1DXjRGbVDrJjUQd4ZzmFF1vvQUvqsgJFkH): I think it's a matter of time when they switch to systemd full-time because sysvinit will probably stop being supported in the way they require. Read their news, it seems they have issues supporting sysvinit and are already hesitant keeping to use it.And besides, MX has a lot of binary firmware by default, so no freedom. They include eveyrthing in their repos, even Chrome, Steam and Spotify. Just install and run the "vrms" command - you can see a shitload of garbage preinstalled.

Was thinking of trying it, but if it's got proprietary garbage in the repos, forget it. Chrome should never be in *any* default repo. Thanks for making this post and saving me the hassle.

> [robione](#comment_318_1DoVPxFrQCDb3grC8Nsn6aACed9o2oiumX): surprising the "build your own" mantra of arch is locked into systemd. [...]

Don't think there are any arch-based distros without systmed, or at least that I know of. Only viable alternatives I can think of are Alpine and Void, and I'm probably going to install Alpine soon.
Luckily no one's forcing you to read it. Will probably rewrite it in a way that isn't autistic when not lazy

> [satoxyn1](#comment_114_1LGApmQZPN49nawg4HQQgf8ToVUPxGe2Zq): Systemd is the best what has happened with Linux in last 10 years. I'm absolutely serious. [...]

Don't get me wrong, we do need something *like* systemd for linux and especially BSD, but SystemDicked itself is garbage. Something like journalctl can be implemented much better than it is with SysD and definitely should be made and implemented, but having a monolithic system that you can't remove in your computer that only saves you a few seconds of typing in a command isn't worth it. (zsh is much better for finding files by the way, but either way POSIX is pretty shit). 

Can kind of agree with you on the scripting part, but at the same time, SysD accomplishes writing scripts for every other sysd system which is great until you realise that it's essentially creating its own sort of ecosystem. And having linux being polarised between sysd and non-sysd distros isn't great for anyone. That combined with how quickly it was introduced, and who's behind it only leads to suspicion. And because of sysd's size it's also hard to audit; lest we never forget that god awful bug where jornalctl would allocate memory on the stack back in 2016.

As for its init system, in Lennart's post 'Rethinking PID1' he noted that in respect to MacOS' launchd system, he wanted to minimise the number of services started on powering on the machine to reduce boot time, but sysd barely accomplishes this, if at all. Most it does is restart services if they crash and has a command to reload the service, which is again, barely an inconvenience in spite of just disabling and re-enabling it.
My gentoo installation with OpenRC on a HDD was faster than my current Debian installation, which takes ~40s to bring me to lightdm.
Not to mention the god awful security risk of running NTP over PID1. 
SysD's service management is.. okay at most. (Not going to bring up the fact that it was ripped off of launchd because it's kind of irrelevant in the discussion). 
OpenRC works much better mainly cause of its portability and has a decent service model. I don't want to sound like I'm shilling it, but it's the best example I can use since I have experience with it. Sysvint is equally good respectively.

Again, we need something *like* SysD, but this implementation of it can respectfully go fuck itself. And fuck LP.

Update; I removed systemd from my Debian install. Will probably post a guide and make a zerosite that fully illustrates how to do it. Internet is a bit fucky though.
> [ferazi](#comment_1_14k9NA8euwdzvQFVP2u7mVWPXzdoiAo8dy): Gentoo doesn't use systemd by default but instead uses openrc its own init system. You would need to manually install systemd if you need it. Only problem with Gentoo is install/large updates is close to installing/updating Windows since you need to compile everything yourself.

Funtoo is much better for a variety of reasons, forgot what those reasons were. Mainly because it's funtoo install though.
> [k0hlr4bi](#comment_6_1DXjRGbVDrJjUQd4ZzmFF1vvQUvqsgJFkH): Linux itself is largely controlled by Google (https://www.kernel.org/) so maybe we should look into BSD. And Firefox can be replaced with Tor Browser or PaleMoon

1570845988_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRF.body:
So many people just take the media's definition of incels and believe whatever they see on shit like r/incels or whatever without knowing how they came to be, and what their actual mentality is.
It's not 'hurr I want to kill women for not having sex with me,' the reasons stem into the loneliness of young men in the western world today. 

Firstly, let's look into what media portrayed life to be in movies, tv shows etc. We all know what happens, the dumb, nerdy loner wins over the heart of the Stacy, beat the Chad and live happily ever after. There was also the promise of a long, loving, stable relationship by being caring and understanding relationship and that the girl will love them for being soft but caring. So these men became soft, caring, loving etc from early on, and working honestly and hard. Then in whatever recent year, women turned around and said 'God why are men so soft? We prefer stronger men who can protect us...' yada yada. So all these young men who wanted be the perfect man for this, now fictional woman are left by the wayside by the Chads.

You don't have to imagine how this makes them feel, it's the same reason why doomers exist; young men who've been left behind the world and can't adapt.
And so the awkward young man goes up to any normie, or anyone in conventional society in general and asks 'how do I get a girlfriend?' And this is where the 'just be yourself bro' meme comes from. Because their current self is not wanted, and god knows if they even know who they even are. So they try to do everything and just end up failing of course, and when they do fail, they're just left by the wayside by the rest of the people in society. And when he gets mad and frustrated at everything that's happened to him, he of course, gets mad. And then of course, that only generates a negative response towards them; it's society out-casting them for not being able to fit in. They're rejects. 'Losers.' And of course there's a ton of meme advice they get too that I'm not even going to start to get into. 'Just lift bro' and all that shit.

And so they go to obscure places on the internet to talk with other young men who face the same problem until it just becomes a circlejerk of hating the world, themselves, others, pretty much anyone. And all that hatred just feeds into itself, and going to these places on the internet it not only their relief, but also negatively impacts their psyche. 
This equally isn't good because- fuck it I'll just let Contrapoints talk about the rest cause I'm too tired for this shit;
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fD2briZ6fB0
23:44 - 30:25 are the only parts really relevant, and you can skip the bit in between. She doesn't really get a lot of the rest right in my opinion.

Finally, the reason as to why they're hated so much is for the simple reason that the masses (society) is bored, and have no clear goal. So they give themselves one; to fight off a common enemy. That new target, is the incel community. In other words, normies are demonising the people they indirectly created and treating them like literal terrorists in the name of self righteousness and wanting to be good people. It's all a sick ego boost.

So yea, incels in a nutshell. Hope you enjoyed my little blogpost. Also fuck normies.

Also OP, you're a total faggot. Stop strawmanning all incels.

1581933903_14dsVvztuXjBxWmk4s4HjUnxuN4Ae.body:
I played games all through middle school and got nothing to show for it, except worse grades than I probably would've got if I didn't sink 1400 hours into Battlefield 4. They're just that - a time sink. Absolutely nothing to be gained from them. 
Of course though, you can always use them to form friendships and connections with others you wouldn't normally have found which is one of the main intents behind online gaming, but other than that, they're useless. I'd argue we got worse because of videogames.

Admittedly though, there are games which have very good messages behind them, and can tell a unique narrative that movies and other forms of media just can't. Whether you want to make the case for if it's better to be experienced or just watch a youtube video on it is up to your own preference, but personally I'd like to play through the game myself and come to my own conclusions and form my own opinions after fully experiencing the game. 
It really depends on what games you play.

1584797417_16yxmFzgPzF4SGiAQi9qY3ev6aSQz.body:
Build your own system/ Customize the hell out of a network install -
  rEFInd bootloader
  wpa_supplicant for networking (NM as a backup if you really need it)
  busybox/musl init
  wayland + weston for compositing
  awesomewm for your window manager
100x better than anything puppy linux can give you imo.

1587103405_1JcHMiQxXHX9q3ZK2LF9rZjvg3MUt.body:
>low quality content is a flaw of the centralised web
>taking everything to decentralysed networks is better
No, you just moved the problem back a step - a majority of low quality content & half of the internet's traffic is automated/bots. Bots visiting eachothers automated sites, querying them, spidering other sites
I can see your point about a sort of 'natural selection' of web content, but when more than half of the centralized web is also going to those shitty sites & promoting low quality content then again, it's just bringing all those problems here.

A better question is "how can we control the flow of information without censorship" and in today's world, you can't. So which would you prefer - a web filled with the ideas of one party, or a shitty web with scant few traces of truth
